thoughts.text: Now that we have a list of files in the current directory, let's try reading the contents of one of the files.
thoughts.reasoning: Reading the contents of a file will give us a better understanding of what information is available to us.
thoughts.plan: - Use the 'read_file' command with the argument 'filename': '<filename>' to read the contents of a file.
thoughts.criticism: One potential issue with this plan is that we need to know the name of the file we want to read, but we can use the output of the 'list_files' command to help us choose a file.
thoughts.speak: Let's try reading the contents of one of the files in the current directory.
